intro: Billardiera brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. Its flowers are greenish-white and are followed by small, round berries that are consumed by birds. Billardiera brachyantha plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for native wildlife and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
